summary: This is a court filing from the United States v. Maxwell case (20 Cr. 330) where the parties submit a joint letter providing a list of names and places for voir dire. It is an email from an Assistant United States Attorney to the court chambers, with copies to defense attorneys.

persons.name: Nathan
persons.context: The email is addressed to Nathan at NYSD Chambers, indicating this is likely a court clerk or staff member in the Southern District of New York.

Both are attorneys copied on the court filing regarding voir dire in the Maxwell case, indicating coordination between legal parties.

events.title: Joint Letter Submission for Voir Dire
events.description: The parties in United States v. Maxwell submitted a joint letter providing a list of names and places for voir dire (jury selection).

locations.name: Southern District of New York

locations.name: One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 100
locations.context: The address of the Assistant United States Attorney's office in the Southern District of New York.

keyFacts: This document is part of the United States v. Maxwell case (docket 20 Cr. 330), indicating ongoing legal proceedings against Ghislaine Maxwell.
The parties jointly submitted a list of names and places for voir dire (jury selection), suggesting preparation for trial or a significant hearing.
Multiple defense attorneys (Laura Menninger, Jeff Pagliuca, Ceverdell) are copied on the filing, indicating a coordinated defense team.
The email is dated November 15, 2021, showing the case was active at that time.
The document shows standard legal procedure with prosecution and defense cooperating on jury selection matters.
